Public Transportation Private Transportation
There is an easy and convenient bus option that departs under the Westin Hotel attached to the DIA airport. Simply follow signage to ‚ÄúWestin Hotel‚Äù and then take the escalators downstairs. You can then take a hard left and purchase a ticket for the ‚ÄúAB‚Äù bus.
There is also ‚ÄúGreenRide‚Äù which is an eco-friendly shuttle option available for a fee. 		The quickest route to Boulder is via the tollway E-470. Alternatively, you can take the toll-free route: Exit DIA on Pena Boulevard. Continue until you reach I-70 West. Take I-70 West to the I-270 North exit toward Fort Follins. Take I-270 North to the U.S. Hwy 36 West exit, toward Boulder, Continue on Hwy 36 to Boulder.
WHAT
We hope you'll be able to join us for a BBQ to celebrate our marriage! Come eat, drink, be merry and enjoy some good company. We do want to stress that this is not a wedding, though. There's no aisle, no bouquet, and we fully anticipate that we'll have left our something borrowed back in Iceland (sorry about that, in advance). But if you're looking for an opportunity to drop in and say hi, this is a perfect chance.

EAT & DRINK

PLAY
Boulder can boast more than 45,000 acres of open space including multitudes of trails and parks available to all! You must checkout Chautauqua Park if you see anything, but Luke and I also encourage you to take Broadway Street up North to visit Lyons, Estes Park, or even Rocky Mountain National Park. There‚Äôs nothing like driving around these breathtaking towns and beautiful mountains with the windows down and music blaring.
